newsitem.title: USA: Allendale pegs U.S. soy 2.09 bln bu, corn 8.95 bln.
newsitem.headline: Allendale pegs U.S. soy 2.09 bln bu, corn 8.95 bln.

text.p: A producer survey conducted by Allendale Inc/Data Transmission Network has projected a soybean crop in the United States of 2.090 billion bushels and corn production of 8.946 billion, research and brokerage firm Allendale said.
The survey, which was conducted August 19-30 and covered 29 states, forecast the U.S. corn yield at 122.09 bushels per acre and the U.S. soybean yield at 32.95 bushels.

The U.S. Department of Agriculture on August 12 put U.S. corn production at 8.695 billion bushels and soybean output at 2.300 billion. USDA forecast a corn yield at 118.7 bushels and soybean yield of 36.2 bushels.
Allendale said producers were disappointed in pod counts.
"Many said the beans were short and/or reported only one to three pods per node," the research firm said.
On corn, the major problem producers talked about was lateness due to planting delays, it said.

"In general, good stands and ideal pollinating weather has caused good kernel counts. However, there were some producers who were unable to count kernels as plants were still silking," Allendale said.
